name: Native American Mythology
description: Explore the diverse mythologies of Native American nations - trickster tales, creation stories, and spirit guides.
overview: Native American mythologies encompass hundreds of distinct tribal traditions across North and South America. Common themes include: trickster figures (Coyote, Raven, Spider), earth diver creation myths, Sky Woman and Turtle Island, spirit animals as guides and teachers, vision quests, sacred pipe ceremonies, and intimate relationship with land. Each nation has unique cosmology - Lakota seven sacred rites, Hopi emergence myth, Navajo Holy People, Iroquois Great Peacemaker. The traditions emphasize balance, respect for all relations (mitakuye oyasin), oral transmission, and continuing living practice.

sections.title: Trickster Figures
sections.body:
**Coyote (Plains, Southwest):** Shape-shifter, fool and creator, brings fire to humanity, establishes death
**Raven (Pacific Northwest):** Transforms world from darkness, steals sun/moon/stars, creates land
**Spider Woman (Navajo, Hopi):** Weaves creation, teaches weaving, guides emergence
**Nanabozho (Anishinaabe):** Culture hero, trickster, recreates world after flood

Tricksters teach through mistakes, challenge social norms, and reveal truths through absurdity.
